intro: Dactylostemon lagoensis, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces edible berries that are often consumed by wildlife and humans alike. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a slightly hairy texture. Dactylostemon lagoensis is typically found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
